paragraphs.text: 7. Create a writing schedule
paragraphs.name: 35bc

paragraphs.text: What makes a writer is the writing. So you’d better get started.
paragraphs.name: 4fd5

paragraphs.text: Fast forward seven years, and now I’m the best-selling author of four books and living the life I always dreamed of. I haven’t gotten everything right along the way, but I have gathered some helpful advice that has kept me going.
paragraphs.name: 99a9

paragraphs.text: 3. Think about your reader
paragraphs.name: c676

paragraphs.text: 6. Set a due date
paragraphs.name: ab99

paragraphs.text: If you’re obsessing over every sentence as you write it, you’re not just being a perfectionist. You’re actually withholding momentum from yourself; you’re preventing yourself from entering into that all-important state of “flow” where the words come easily and the goal feels achievable.
8. Write, don’t edit
paragraphs.name: a2c2

paragraphs.text: Everything’s been done before, but you haven’t done it before. That’s the difference. That’s your premise.
paragraphs.name: f387

paragraphs.text: The golden rule of writing is that you must know your audience. You must know a lot about them and their needs so that when you write, they know you understand where they’re coming from. If you do that, if you meet them where they are, you can lift them up to where you want them to be.
paragraphs.name: 7b13

paragraphs.text: You must have something important to share before you start writing. Like F. Scott Fitzgerald said, “You don’t write because you want to say something. You write because you have something to say.” What will you write about?
paragraphs.name: d05a

paragraphs.text: Why? Because I wasn’t writing. I didn’t even know where to start.
paragraphs.name: f449

paragraphs.text: When I was struggling with this, I went one level deeper and started writing about writing. Turns out, that was the perfect first step for me, because I’m still doing it today.
paragraphs.name: 8e21

cc10bbf45feb.title: Extremely important to get yourself to actually write.

paragraphs.text: These are all good tips for non-fiction books. I find the first two tips a bit more difficult to apply to fiction/creative writing, even though you can strive to use them. Of course you still need to have a topic and a premise for fiction (what the book is about) but it tends to be more nebulous and the writing itself takes you in more unexpected…

64203ae71e19.title: Helpful, but the reality is that the writing choses you and not the other way around.

paragraphs.text: Helpful, but the reality is that the writing choses you and not the other way around. At least that has to be the approach. To be a writer is one thing, to be writing is another. The words must be bursting out of you, and not simply forced out.
